param.description: number of called add-ons

method.name: getApiFunc
method.description: Retrieves all API functions and variables that match a specific word. Useful for script code auto-completion functionality

param.name: apiWord
param.description: word that API functions and variables should match, e.g. "sim.getObj". Only matches up to the first dot are returned, if the apiWord does not contain any dot. To retrieve all functions and variables, leave apiWord empty. To retrieve only functions, add '+' as prefix. To retrieve only variables, add '-' as prefix.

param.name: funcsAndVars
param.description: array containing all matching API functions and variables.

method.name: getApiInfo
method.description: Returns the call tip (or info text) for an API function

param.name: apiWord
param.description: API functions or variable to retrieve the info for, e.g. "sim.getObject". Return is for the latest version of a module by default. For a specific module version, specify its full name, e.g. "sim-1.getObject". Using the wildcard, e.g. "sim-*.getObject", the returned information is prepended by its related module name (e.g. "[sim-1]"), for all available modules

param.name: info
param.description: information related to the API function or variable

method.name: callFunction
method.description: Calls a script function. This represents a user callback inside of a script. The target smust be initialized for this call to succeed, e.g. when calling from simulation scripts , then simulation must be running

param.name: functionName
param.description: the function to call.

param.name: inArg
param.description: argument to be handed over to the called function.

param.name: outArg
param.description: return from the called function.

method.name: getFunctions
method.description: Retrieves a map of the script's functions that can be called

param.name: object
param.description: a meta object. Functions can be called with object:functionName()

method.name: executeString
method.description: Executes some code from a string. The target must be initialized for this call to succeed, e.g. when calling from simulation scripts , then simulation must be running

param.name: stringToExecute
param.description: a string representing the code to execute in the specified script. An optional @python or @lua can be appended, to force a specific language

param.name: result
param.description: 0 or 1

param.name: executionResult
param.description: return value of the executed code

method.name: getStackTraceback
method.description: Retrieves and clears the last generated stack traceback for a script

param.name: stackTraceback
param.description: the stack traceback

method.name: init
method.description: Initializes/reinitializes a script. Operates in an asynchronous way when called upon the calling script

method.name: addItem
method.description: Adds one or several items to a collection

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of a scene object

param.name: what
param.description:
type of object (or group of objects) to add. Following are allowed values:
sim.handle_single (for a single object)
sim.handle_all (for all objects in the scene)
sim.handle_tree (for a tree of objects)
sim.handle_chain (for a chain of objects (i.e. an inverted tree)).

param.name: exclude
param.description: if true, then the specified object is not included in the group of objects to add, if sim.handle_tree or sim.handle_chain is specified (i.e. the tree base or tip is excluded)

method.name: removeItem
method.description: Removes one or several items from a collection

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of a scene object

param.name: what
param.description:
type of object (or group of objects) to remove. Following are allowed values:
sim.handle_single (for a single object)
sim.handle_all (for all objects in the scene)
sim.handle_tree (for a tree of objects)
sim.handle_chain (for a chain of objects (i.e. an inverted tree)).

param.name: exclude
param.description: if true, then the specified object is not included in the group of objects to remove, if sim.handle_tree or sim.handle_chain is specified (i.e. the tree base or tip is excluded)

method.name: checkCollision
method.description: Checks whether this collection collides with another collection or scene object. If the entity to check against is a scene object, then its collidable flag is ignored. If the entity to check against is the same collection, then a self-collision check is performed

param.name: entityHandle
param.description: handle of the other entity (can be a scene object or another collection), or sim.handle_all to check this collection against all other collidable scene objects

param.name: result
param.description: indicates the collision state

param.name: collidingObjectHandles
param.description: array containing the colliding scene object pair

method.name: checkDistance
method.description: Checks the minimum distance between this collection and another collection or scene object. If the entity to check against is a scene object, then its measurable flag is ignored. If the entity to check against is the same collection, then the minimum distance within this collection is computed

param.name: entityHandle
param.description: handle of the other entity (can be a scene object or another collection), or sim.handle_all to check this collection against all other measurable scene objects

param.name: threshold
param.description: if distance is bigger than the threshold, the distance is not calculated and result is false

param.name: result
param.description: true if distance is smaller than the threshold

param.name: dist
param.description: distance

param.name: p1
param.description: point on entity 1

param.name: p2
param.description: point on entity 2

param.name: objectHandlePair
param.description: array of 2 object handles representing the two objects that hold the minimum distance segment

method.name: addItems
method.description: Adds items to a drawing object

param.name: items
param.description: data relative to items, in column-major order. If the items are point items, the matrix should be 3 * n in size. If the items are line items, the matrix should be 3 * n in size, etc

method.name: addPackedItems
method.description: Adds packed items to a drawing object

param.name: items
param.description: a buffer of packed single-precision float values. If the items are point items, there should be 3 * n packed floats. If the items are line items, there should be 3 * n packed floats, etc

method.name: clearItems
method.description: Clears a drawing object

method.name: duplicateObjects
method.description: Duplicates scene objects

param.name: objects
param.description: array of scene objects to duplicate

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded options:
bit0 is set (i.e. 1): whole models are copied. In that case, all specified scene objects should be flagged as model base
bit1 is set (i.e. 2): all scripts are stripped away
bit2 is set (i.e. 4): all scene object custom data properties are stripped away
bit3 is set (i.e. 8): all scene object references are stripped away
bit4 is set (i.e. 16): all textures are stripped away
bit5 is set (i.e. 32): model tags and DNA information is stripped away

param.name: duplicateObjects
param.description: the duplicate scene objects, where original and copy have the same location in their respective arrays (when scripts are stripped away, the array could contain -1 values)

method.name: checkCollision
method.description: Checks whether this scene object collides with another scene object or a collection. The collidable flag of this object (and of the other entity if it is also a scene object) is ignored

param.name: entityHandle
param.description: handle of the other entity (can be a collection or another scene object), or sim.handle_all to check this scene object against all other collidable scene objects

param.name: result
param.description: indicates the collision state

param.name: collidingObjectHandles
param.description: array containing the colliding scene object pair

method.name: checkDistance
method.description: Checks the minimum distance between this scene object and another scene object or a collection. The measurable flag of this object (and of the other entity if it is also a scene object) is ignored

param.name: entityHandle
param.description: handle of the other entity (can be a collection or another scene object), or sim.handle_all to check this collection against all other measurable scene objects

param.name: threshold
param.description: if distance is bigger than the threshold, the distance is not calculated and result is false

param.name: result
param.description: true if distance is smaller than the threshold

param.name: dist
param.description: distance

param.name: p1
param.description: point on entity 1

param.name: p2
param.description: point on entity 2

param.name: objectHandlePair
param.description: array of 2 object handles representing the two objects that hold the minimum distance segment

method.name: getAlias
method.description: Retrieves the alias or path of a scene object

param.name: options
param.description:
alias formating options:
-1: naked alias (e.g. "alias")
0: ordered alias (e.g. "alias[0]")
1: short path that fully identifies the object (e.g. "/parent/alias[0]")
2: full path (e.g. "/parentA/parentB/alias[0]")
3: naked alias with handle, if the alias is not unique (e.g. "alias" or "alias__42__")
4: naked alias with handle (e.g. "alias__42__")
5: print version of the short path, not guaranteed to be unique (e.g. "/parent/ ... /alias")
6: path using just the alias and an index number (e.g. "/alias{3}")
7: same as 6, but using the first parent model, if present (e.g. "/parentModel{2}/alias{3}")
8: same as 6, but using the first 2 parent models, if present (e.g. "/parentModelA{4}/parentModelB{2}/alias{3}")
9: same as 6, but using all parent models, if present (e.g. "/parentModelA{4}/.../parentModelN{2}/alias{3}")

param.name: alias
param.description: alias or path of the scene object

method.name: setAlias
method.description: Sets the alias of a scene object

param.name: objectAlias
param.description: alias of the scene object. Allowed characters include 0-9, a-z, A-Z, and underscores. Illegal characters are replaced with underscores

method.name: getPose
method.description: Retrieves the pose of a scene object

param.name: relativeToObject
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame we want the pose. Specify sim.handle_world to retrieve the absolute pose, sim.handle_inverse to retrieve the inverse of the absolute pose, sim.handle_parent to retrieve the pose relative to the object's parent, or an object relative to whose reference frame we want the pose

param.name: relativeToJointBaseFrame
param.description: If argument relativeToObject is a joint, then the pose relative to the joint's moving frame is returned, unless this argument is true, in which case the pose relative to the joint's base frame is returned

param.name: p
param.description: the pose: [x, y, z, qx, qy, qz, qw]

method.name: getObjectPosition
method.description: Retrieves the position of an object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe (see next argument)

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame we want the position. Specify sim.handle_world to retrieve the absolute position, sim.handle_parent to retrieve the position relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame we want the position. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the position relative to the joint's moving frame will be returned (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the position relative to the joint's base frame will be returned).

param.name: pos
param.description: the position

method.name: getObjectQuaternion
method.description: Retrieves the quaternion of an object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Combine with sim.handleflag_wxyzquat to retrieve the quaternion as [qw qx qy qz] order instead of [qx qy qz qw] order. Can also be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe (see next argument)

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame we want the orientation. Specify sim.handle_world to retrieve the absolute orientation, sim.handle_parent to retrieve the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame you want the orientation. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the quaternion relative to the joint's moving frame will be returned (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the quaternion relative to the joint's base frame will be returned).

param.name: quat
param.description: the quaternion: [qx, qy, qz, qw]

method.name: createDrawingObject
method.description: Creates a drawing object that will be displayed in the scene. Drawing objects are containers that hold several items of a given type. This can be used for several different applications (simulation of paint, simulation of welding seam, display of 3D objects, etc.). Drawing objects created in a simulation script will be automatically removed at simulation end

param.name: objectType
param.description: a drawing object type combined with attributes

param.name: size
param.description: size of the item (width of lines or size of points are in pixels, other sizes are in meters

param.name: duplicateTolerance
param.description: if different from 0.0, then a call to simAddDrawingObjectItem will only add the item if there is no other item within duplicateTolerance distance. Useful to avoid adding a too high density of points, is however not appropriate when using a large number of points (slower operation). Applicable only for single vertex items.

param.name: parentObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the scene object where the drawing items should keep attached to (if the scene object moves, the drawing items will also move), or -1 if the drawing items are relative to the world (fixed)

param.name: maxItemCount
param.description: maximum number of items this object can hold. 0 uses a default size of 1000.

param.name: color
param.description: default color (3 rgb values). Can be None/nil

param.name: drawingObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the drawing object

method.name: addForce
method.description: Adds a non-central force to a shape object that is dynamically enabled. Added forces are cumulative, applied relative to the center of mass, and are reset to zero after sim.handleDynamics was called (or by using the following flag: sim.handleflag_resetforcetorque)

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of a dynamically enabled shape. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_resetforcetorque in order to clear the accumulated force and torque.

param.name: position
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the relative position where the force should be applied.

param.name: force
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the force (in relative coordinates) to add.

method.name: addLog
method.description: Adds a log message that will be output in the console or status bar

param.name: verbosity

Combine with sim.verbosity_undecorated if you wish to output the naked message. sim.verbosity_scripterrors will additionaly raise an error.

param.name: message
param.description: the message. None/nil clears the status bar

method.name: addParticleObject
method.description: Adds a particle object that will be simulated and displayed in the scene. Particle objects are containers that hold several items (particles) of a given type. This can be used for several different applications (e.g. simulation of air/water jets)

param.name: objectType
param.description: a particle object type combined with attributes

param.name: size
param.description: diameter of the particles (spheres)

param.name: density
param.description: density of the particles

param.name: parameters
param.description:
an array of values, allowing to specify additional parameters. Can be None/nil. Values come in pair (an integer indicating what parameter, and a float indicating the parameter value. Following indicates the parameters:
0: Bullet friction coefficient (default: 0.0)
1: Bullet restitution coefficient (default: 0.0)
2: ODE friction coefficient (default: 0.0)
3: ODE soft ERP value (default: 0.2)
4: ODE soft CFM values (default: 0.0)
5: Bullet, ODE, Newton and Vortex linear drag parameter (default: 0.0). Adds a force opposite to the particle velocity (f=v*parameter)
6: Bullet, ODE, Newton and Vortex quadratic drag parameter (default: 0.0). Adds a force opposite to the particle velocity (f=v*v*parameter)
7: Bullet, ODE, Newton and Vortex linear drag parameter in air (z>0) if sim.particle_water was specified (default: 0.0). Adds a force opposite to the particle velocity (f=v*parameter)
8: Bullet, ODE, Newton and Vortex quadratic drag parameter in air (z>0) if sim.particle_water was specified (default: 0.0). Adds a force opposite to the particle velocity (f=v*v*parameter)
9: Vortex friction (default: 0.0)
10: Vortex restitution (default: 0.0)
11: Vortex restitution threshold (default: 0.001)
12: Vortex compliance (default: 0.0)
13: Vortex damping (default: 0.0)
14: Vortex adhesive force (default: 0.0)
15: Newton static friction (default: 0.0)
16: Newton kinetic friction (default: 0.0)
17: Newton restitution (default: 0.0)
If a parameter is not set, then its default value is used

param.name: lifeTime
param.description: 0: Bullet friction coefficient (default: 0.0)

param.name: maxItemCount
param.description: 1: Bullet restitution coefficient (default: 0.0)

param.name: color
param.description: 2: ODE friction coefficient (default: 0.0)

param.name: particleObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the particle object

method.name: addParticleObjectItem
method.description: Adds an item (or clears all items) to a previously inserted particle object

param.name: particleObjectHandle
param.description: handle of a previously added particle object

param.name: itemData
param.description: data relative to an item. All items (particles) require at least 6 values: p1x, p1y, p1z, p2x, p2y, p2z with p1 is the particle start position, p2-p1 is the particle initial velocity vector. Auxiliary values might be required depending on the particle object attributes. See the particle object type combined with attributes for more information. If None/nil, the particle object is emptied of all its items

method.name: adjustView
method.description: Adjusts parameters of a view

param.name: viewHandleOrIndex
param.description: handle of the view (can also be a floating view), or the index of the view.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that you wish to associate with the view. Must be a viewable object. Can also be -1, in which case the view is emptied

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0-bit5 = 0
bit6 (64) set=floating view is removed at simulation end
bit7 (128) set=floating view is ignored during a scene save operation
bit8 (256) set=the view is not modified. The return value of the function indicates if the view still exists (2), or does not exist anymore (1). No error is generated.
bit9 (512) set=the view is not modified. The return value of the function represents the object associated with the view.

param.name: res
param.description: a value >0 in case of success

method.name: alignShapeBB
method.description: Reorients the bounding box of a shape, while keeping the shape frame in place. The shape's inertia properties are unaffected

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape

param.name: p
param.description: pose describing the new orientation of the shape's bounding box. The pose is expressed as [x y z qx qy qz qw], where the positional part is ignored. A pose containing only zeros aligns the bounding box with the mesh's natural bounding box

method.name: announceSceneContentChange
method.description: Announces a change in the scene. This is required for the undo/redo function to operate properly when performing changes via the API. Only call this function directly after a change was made through a dialog element (e.g. a checkbox was checked/unchecked) and that change was reported to the scene. What this call will do is following: the whole scene will be serialized (saved) to memory as a "scene image" and compared to a previously memorized "scene image". If both images are same, then the last image is discarded, otherwise only the changes between the two images are memorized. A call to this function has no effect (and doesn't generate any error) when called during simulation or when in edit mode.

method.name: cameraFitToView
method.description: Shifts and adjusts a camera associated with a view to fill the view entirely with the specified objects or models

param.name: viewHandleOrIndex

handle of the view (can also be a floating view), or the index of the view. If the camera is not associated with any view, then you can specify the handle of the camera, together with the

flag.

param.name: options

bit-coded:
bit0 (1): if set, then individual objects will be filling the view. If not set, then models associated with model base objects will also be included

method.name: createProximitySensor

param.description: deprecated. Set to 16

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded options:
bit0 set (1): the sensor will be explicitly handled
bit1 set (2): reserved. Set to 0
bit2 set (4): the detection volume is not shown
bit3 set (8): front faces are not detected
bit4 set (16): back faces are not detected
bit5 set (32): fast detection (i.e. not exact detection)
bit6 set (64): the normal of the detected surface with the detection ray will have to lie below a specified threshold angle
bit8 set (256): smallest distance threshold will be active
bit9 set (512): randomized detection (only with ray-type proximity sensors)

param.description: bit0 set (1): the sensor will be explicitly handled

param.name: floatParams
param.description: bit1 set (2): reserved. Set to 0

param.description: handle of the force sensor

method.name: createShape
method.description: Creates a mesh shape

param.name: options
param.description:
Bit-coded:
if bit0 is set (1), backfaces are culled
If bit1 is set (2), edges are visible
If bit2 is set (4), adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated
If bit3 is set (8), texture is applied as a decal
If bit4 is set (16), texture is RGBA, otherwise it is RGB
If bit5 is set (32), texture is horizontally flipped
If bit6 is set (64), texture is vertically flipped

param.name: shadingAngle
param.description: if bit0 is set (1), backfaces are culled

param.name: vertices
param.description: If bit1 is set (2), edges are visible

param.name: indices
param.description: If bit2 is set (4), adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated

param.name: normals
param.description: If bit3 is set (8), texture is applied as a decal

param.name: textureCoordinates
param.description: If bit4 is set (16), texture is RGBA, otherwise it is RGB

param.name: texture
param.description: If bit5 is set (32), texture is horizontally flipped

param.name: textureResolution
param.description: If bit6 is set (64), texture is vertically flipped

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of the newly created shape

bit3 set (8): repeat the texture along the V direction.

param.description: set (2): apply the texture in decal-mode.

param.name: xy_g

param.name: fixedResolution

param.name: res

method.name: createVisionSensor

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded options:
bit 0 set (1): sensor will be explicitly handled
bit 1 set (2): sensor will be in perspective operation mode

bit 3 set (8): reserved. Set to 0
bit 4 set (16): sensor will be passive (use an external image)

bit 7 set (128): sensor will use a specific color for default background (i.e. null pixels)

3: TEXT STL format
4: BINARY STL format
5: COLLADA format
6: TEXT PLY format
7: BINARY PLY format

param.name: pathAndFilename
param.description: 0: OBJ format

param.name: options
param.description: 3: TEXT STL format

param.name: scalingFactor
param.description: 4: BINARY STL format

param.name: vertices
param.description: 5: COLLADA format

param.name: indices
param.description: 6: TEXT PLY format

more.code:
--lua
-- Exports all shapes in the scene import('simEigen', '*') local allVertices = {} local allIndices = {} local allShapes = sim.scene:getDescendants({'shape'}) for j = 1, #allShapes do local shape = allShapes[j] local vertices, indices = shape:getMeshData() local p = shape.absPose for i = 1, #vertices // 3, 1 do local v = Vector{vertices[3 * (i - 1) +1], vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 2], vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 3]} v = p * v vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 1] = v[1] vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 2] = v[2] vertices[3 * (i - 1) + 3] = v[3] end table.insert(allVertices, vertices) table.insert(allIndices, indices) end
if #allVertices > 0 then sim.exportMesh(0, "d:\\example.obj", 0, 1, allVertices, allIndices) end

method.name: floatingViewAdd
method.description: Adds a floating view to current page

param.name: posX
param.description: relative position of the center of the floating view. Accepted values are between 0.0 and 1.0

param.name: posY
param.description: relative size of the floating view. Accepted values are between 0.0 and 1.0

param.name: sizeX
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): double click allows swapping the floating view with the main view
bit1 set (2): the floating view doesn't have a close button
bit2 set (4): the floating view cannot be shifted
bit3 set (8): the floating view cannot be resized

param.name: sizeY
param.description: bit0 set (1): double click allows swapping the floating view with the main view

param.name: options
param.description: bit1 set (2): the floating view doesn't have a close button

param.name: floatingViewHandle
param.description: handle of the floating view

method.name: floatingViewRemove
method.description: Removes a floating view previously added with sim.floatingViewAdd .

param.name: floatingViewHandle
param.description: handle of the floating view to be removed

param.name: result
param.description: 0 if the floating view could not be found (e.g. because closed by the user), or 1 if the floating view was closed.

method.name: generateShapeFromPath
method.description: Generates an extrusion shape from a path

param.name: path
param.description: path, specified in row-major order, with [x y z qx qy qz qw] values for each path point. The orientation parts for each path point are ignored if the two first bits of are zero.

param.name: section
param.description: extrusion profile, with x/y pairs, e.g. [x1 y1 x2 y2 ... xn yn]. If the first and last pair overlap, the section is closed

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0-bit1: 0 = upVector is upVector , 1 = upVector is the x-axis of the path point frame, 2 = upVector is the y-axis of the path point frame, 3 = upVector is the z-axis of the path point frame
bit2 set (4): the path is closed

param.name: upVector
param.description: bit0-bit1: 0 = upVector is , 1 = upVector is the x-axis of the path point frame, 2 = upVector is the y-axis of the path point frame, 3 = upVector is the z-axis of the path point frame

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: the handle of the generated shape

param.name: color
param.description: the text color. Optional

param.name: height
param.description: the height of the text. Optional

param.name: centered

param.name: alphabetLocation

param.name: modelHandle

method.name: generateTimeOptimalTrajectory
method.description: Generates a time optimal trajectory, based on the TOPPRA library

param.name: path
param.description: path, specified in row-major order, e.g. a path containing two 3D positions would be [x1 y1 z1 x2 y2 z2]

param.name: pathLengths
param.description: lengths of a path. Each path point should have a corresponding length value (as the distance from the path's first point, along the path). See also sim.getPathLengths .

param.name: minMaxVel
param.description: minimum and maximum allowed velocity, for each dimension/axis, e.g. {xmin,xmax,ymin,ymax,zmin,zmax}

param.name: minMaxAccel
param.description: minimum and maximum allowed acceleration, for each dimension/axis, e.g. [xmin xmax ymin ymax zmin zmax]

param.name: trajPtSamples
param.description: desired number of path points/configurations

param.name: boundaryCondition
param.description: boundary condition

param.name: timeout
param.description: a timeout duration

param.name: calculationScriptHandle
param.description: optional. Can indicate a script handle returned in a previous call to this function, including -1 to indicate that the created calculation script should be returned for future reuse

param.name: outP
param.description: generated path points

param.name: times
param.description: generated times corresponding to path points

param.name: scriptHandle
param.description: the handle of the calculation script for reuse in a subsequent call to this function

method.name: getClosestPosOnPath
method.description: Returns the position or distance along a path that is closest to a specified point in space

param.name: path
param.description: path, specified in row-major order, with x/y/z values for each path point

param.name: pathLengths
param.description: lengths of a path. Each path point should have a corresponding length value (as the distance from the path's first point, along the path). See also sim.getPathLengths .

param.name: absPt
param.description: point in 3D space

param.name: posAlongPath
param.description: position/distance along the path

method.name: getConfigDistance
method.description: Returns the distance between two configurations points

param.name: configA
param.description: the first configuration, e.g. in case of a 3D pose (position+quaternion), would be [x1 y1 z1 qx1 qy1 qz1 qw1]

param.name: configB
param.description: the second configuration

param.name: metric
param.description: an optional array specifying the metric to use to compute distances. e.g. if the specified configurations were 3D positions, the distance between two configurations would be calculated as SQRT( mx * (x2 - x1)^2 + my * (y2 - y1)^2 + mz * (z2 - z1)^2 ), where [mx my mz] would be the metric.

param.name: types
param.description: an optional array specifying the type of each configuration value/dimension: 0=cartesian value, 1=2pi-cyclic value, 2=quaternion value. e.g. a configuration representing 3D poses should use a types argument [0 0 0 2 2 2 2], a configuration representing revolute and cyclic joints should use a types argument [1 1 1 ...]

param.name: distance
param.description: the distance between the two configurations

method.name: getContactInfo
method.description: Retrieves contact point information of a dynamic simulation pass.

param.name: dynamicPass
param.description: a specific dynamic sub-step index or sim.handle_all. By default a call to simHandleDynamics executes the dynamics engine x times, with x times smaller time steps (where x is a parameter that can be adjusted). At each of those sub-steps, contacts are created and destroyed. With the dynamicPass argument you can select which sub-step you wish to retrieve contacts from (zero-based index), or sim.handle_all to retrieve the contacts of all sub-steps. See also the dynamicsStepSize property.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of a specific object you wish to retrieve contacts from, or sim.handle_all to retrieve all contacts in the scene.

param.name: index
param.description: zero-based index of the contact to retrieve

param.name: coll
param.description: handles of the two objects contacting. The handles might also refer to particle objects that are not treated as regular scene objects

param.name: point
param.description: coordinates of the contact

param.name: rForce
param.description: vector that represents the force generated by the contact

param.name: n
param.description: normal vector at the contact point

method.name: getExplicitHandling
method.description: Retrieves the explicit handling flags for a scene object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of a scene object

param.name: explicitHandlingFlags
param.description: the explicit handling flags for the specified object (for now only bit 0 is used)

method.name: getExtensionString
method.description: Retrieves a string that describes additional environment or object properties, mainly used by extension plugins.

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of an object, or -1 if you wish to retrieve the extension string of the environment

param.name: index
param.description: keep to -1, unless the object is a shape, and you wish to retrieve the extension string of a shape component (since a shape can be a compound of several other shapes)

param.name: key
param.description:
optional key indicating what value to retrieve. If None/nil is specified, then the whole extension string is returned. Keys should have the form of
key@parentKey@...@parentKey
. To retrieve the
shadow enabled
value of extension string "povray{ shadow {true} fadeXDist {0.00}}", specify following key:
shadow@povray
. The key is case sensitive.

param.name: theString
param.description: the desired string

method.name: getJointDependency

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: handle of the slave joint

param.name: masterJointHandle
param.description: handle of the master joint, or -1 if the joint is not dependent

param.name: offset
param.description: offset in equation slave = offset + master * multCoeff

param.name: multCoeff
param.description: coeff in equation slave = offset + master * multCoeff

method.name: getJointForce
method.description: Retrieves the force or torque applied to a joint along/about its active axis. This function retrieves meaningful information only if the joint is prismatic or revolute, and is dynamically enabled. With the Bullet, MuJoCo and Newton engine, this function returns the force or torque applied to the joint motor (torques from joint limits are not taken into account). With the ODE and Vortex engine, this function returns the total force or torque applied to a joint along/about its z-axis

param.name: jointHandle
param.description: handle of the joint. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_rawvalue (simply add sim.handleflag_rawvalue to jointHandle), if you wish to access the raw values generated by each individual dynamic simulation step (by default, there are 10 dynamic simulation steps for each simulation step). Raw values can only be accessed from inside a callback function triggered by the physics engine.

param.name: forceOrTorque
param.description: force or the torque applied to the joint along/about its z-axis.

method.name: getJointInterval

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the joint

param.name: cyclic

param.name: interval
param.description: interval of the joint. interval[1] is the joint minimum allowed value, interval[2] is the joint range (the maximum allowed value is interval[1]+interval[2]). When the joint is "cyclic", then the interval parameters don't have any meaning.

method.name: getObjectVelocity
method.description: Retrieves the linear and/or angular velocity of an object, in absolute coordinates. The velocity is a measured velocity (i.e. from one simulation step to the next), and is available for all objects in the scene

param.name: objectHandle
param.description:
handle of a scene object . It is highly recommended to add
sim.handleflag_axis
to the object handle, in order to obtain the
regular
angular velocity for the object, i.e. the rotation axis and the rotation velocity that is represented by the axis' length. If
sim.handleflag_axis
is omitted, then a derivative of Euler angles expressed relative to previous' simulation frame will be returned for the angular velocity

param.name: linearVelocity
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the linear velocity

param.name: angularVelocity
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the angular velocity

method.name: getPathInterpolatedConfig
method.description: Returns an interpolated configuration from a path

param.name: path
param.description: the path, specified in row-major order, e.g. a path containing two 3D poses (position+quaternion) would be [x1 y1 z1 qx1 qy1 qz1 qw1 x2 y2 z2 qx2 qy2 qz2 qw2]

param.name: pathLengths
param.description: the lengths of a path. Each path point should have a corresponding length value (as the distance from the path's first point, along the path). See also sim.getPathLengths .

param.name: t
param.description: the distance from the beginning of the path, where the interpolation point should be picked from

param.name: method
param.description: an optional map specifying the type of interpolation (linear or quadraticBezier), whether the path should be considered as open, even if the first and last path points overlap, and the bezier strength (0.05-1.0)

param.name: types
param.description: an optional array specifying the type of each configuration value/dimension: 0=cartesian value, 1=2pi-cyclic value, 2=quaternion value. e.g. a configuration representing 3D poses should use a types argument [0 0 0 2 2 2 2], a configuration representing revolute and cyclic joints should use a types argument [1 1 1 ...]

param.name: config
param.description: the interpolated path configuration

method.name: getPathLengths
method.description: Returns the lengths of a path in 1, 2 or 3D Cartesian space, even if more coordinates are provided. Each path point will have a corresponding length value (taken as the distance from the path's first point, along the path)

param.name: path
param.description: the path, specified in row-major order, e.g. a path containing two 3D poses (position+quaternion) would be [x1 y1 z1 qx1 qy1 qz1 qw1 x2 y2 z2 qx2 qy2 qz2 qw2]

param.name: dof
param.description: the size or dimension of path points, e.g. in case of a 3D pose, this would be 7 (however only the first 3 dimensions would be taken into account)

param.name: distCallback
param.description: an optional function that takes as input two configurations, and returns the calculated distance between them. See also sim.getConfigDistance

param.name: pathLengths
param.description: the lengths corresponding to each path point

param.name: totalLength
param.description: the total length of the path

param.name: maxPtCntPerVoxel
param.description: maximum number of points allowed in a same OC tree voxel

param.name: opt
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): points have random colors
bit1 set (2): show OC tree structure
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep unset
bit3 set (8): do not use an OC tree structure. When enabled, point cloud operations are limited, and point clouds will not be collidable , measurable or detectable anymore, but adding points will be much faster
bit4 set (16): color is emissive

method.name: getSimulatorMessage
method.description: Retrieves and removes the next message in the C/C++ or Lua message queues. Use this in a while-loop until all messages have been extracted. While the C/C++ interface has one single message queue, each Lua script has its own message queue. The C/C++ version of this function should only be called from the CoppeliaSim client application. A given message queue cannot hold more than 64 messages, unread messages will be discarded.

param.description: array of numbers that describe the returned message in more details

param.description: array of 3 values that represent the linear velocity in absolute coordinates

param.description: array of 3 values that represent the angular velocity in absolute coordinates. The length of the vector represents the rotation speed, and the vector direction represents the rotation axis passing through the center of mass of the shape

method.name: getVisionSensorDepth
method.description: Reads the depth buffer of a vision sensor. The returned data doesn't make sense if sim.handleVisionSensor wasn't called previously

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor

param.name: options
param.description:
options, bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the returned values indicate distances in meters, otherwise return values are in the range of 0.0 - 1.0 (0.0 = closest to sensor (i.e. close clipping plane), 1.0 = farthest from sensor (i.e. far clipping plane))

param.name: pos
param.description: bit0 set (1): the returned values indicate distances in meters, otherwise return values are in the range of 0.0 - 1.0 (0.0 = closest to sensor (i.e. close clipping plane), 1.0 = farthest from sensor (i.e. far clipping plane))

param.name: size
param.description: position of the depth buffer portion to retrieve. Defaults to [0 0]

param.name: depth
param.description: the depth buffer. Use sim.unpackFloatTable to obtain an array of values

param.name: resolution
param.description: the vision sensor resolution

method.name: getVisionSensorImg
method.description: Reads the image of a vision sensor. The returned data doesn't make sense if sim.handleVisionSensor wasn't called previously

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor

param.name: options
param.description:
options, bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the returned image will by a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image
bit1 set (2): the returned image will have one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

param.name: rgbaCutOff
param.description: bit0 set (1): the returned image will by a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image

param.name: pos
param.description: bit1 set (2): the returned image will have one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

param.name: size
param.description:
when an RGBA image is returned, the alpha component is 255 for all depth values below
rgbaCutOff
, and 0 for all depth values above
rgbaCutOff
. 0.0 corresponds to the near clipping plane, 1.0 to the far clipping plane

param.name: image
param.description: the image buffer. Use sim.unpackUInt8Table to obtain an array of integer values

param.name: resolution
param.description: the vision sensor resolution

method.name: getVisionSensorRes
method.description: Returns the resolution of the vision sensor

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor

param.name: resolution
param.description: array containing the x and y resolution

method.name: groupShapes
method.description: Groups (or merges) several shapes into a compound shape (or simple shape )

param.description: handles of the shapes to be grouped or merged. The last handle represents the shape that will accept the other shapes

param.name: merge
param.description: whether the shapes should be merged or grouped

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description:
the handle of the resulting compound shape, which is the last shape in
shapeHandles

method.name: handleDynamics

param.description: simulation time step, i.e. sim.getSimulationTimeStep ()

param.name: result
param.description: 0 if the sepcified physics engine could not be found, otherwise the number of calculation steps performed by the physics engine.

method.name: handleExtCalls
method.description: Handles the message pump for threaded scripts

method.name: handleGraph
method.description: Handles a graph object (i.e. records another value for each curve, given that such value was provided via sim.setGraphStreamValue

param.name: graphHandle
param.description: handle of the graph object.

param.name: time
param.description: time where next value will be recorded at, usually the simulation time

method.name: handleProximitySensor
method.description: Handles (performs sensing, etc. of) a registered proximity sensor object

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of a proximity sensor object, or sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit

param.name: res
param.description: 0 if nothing was detected

param.name: dist
param.description: distance to the detected point

param.name: point
param.description: array of 3 numbers indicating the relative coordinates of the detected point

param.name: obj

param.name: n

method.name: handleSensingStart
method.description:
Handles various functionality (e.g. camera tracking during simulation, object velocity calculation, etc.). Should only be called from the main script , as the first instruction in the
sensing
section

method.name: handleSimulationStart
method.description:
Initializes various functionality (e.g. camera tracking during simulation, object velocity calculation, etc.). Should only be called from the main script , as the first instruction in the
initialization
section

method.name: handleVisionSensor
method.description: Handles (performs sensing, etc. of) a vision sensor object. It (1) clear previous computed image processing data, (2) reads an image and (3) performs image processing via the vision callback functions (if the vision sensor is using an external input only (1) is performed)

param.name: visionSensorHandle
param.description: handle of a vision sensor object or sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit

param.name: detectionCount
param.description: number of detections (number of vision sensors that triggered a detection)

param.name: packet1
param.description: default auxiliary value packet (15 auxiliary values: the minimum of [intensity red green blue depth], the maximum of [intensity red green blue depth], and the average of [intensity red green blue depth])

param.name: packet2
param.description: additional auxiliary value packet (e.g. from an image processing component)

method.name: importMesh
method.description: Imports a mesh from a file

param.name: fileformat
param.description: set to 0. Fileformat is automatically detected

param.name: pathAndFilename
param.description: the location of the file to import.

param.name: options
param.description: bit-coded: bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices, bit7 set (128): ignore up-vector coded in fileformat

param.name: identicalVerticeTolerance
param.description: has no effect. set to zero

param.name: scalingFactor
param.description: the scaling factor to apply to the imported vertices

param.name: vertices
param.description: an array of vertice arrays. The import operation may generate several meshes depending on the fileformat

param.name: indices
param.description: an array of index arrays. The import operation may generate several meshes depending on the fileformat

more.code:
--lua
local vertices, indices, reserved, names = sim.importMesh(1, "d:\\example.dxf", 0, 0.0001, 1) for i = 1, #vertices, 1 do h = sim.createShape(2, 20 * math.pi / 180, vertices[i], indices[i]) sim.setShapeColor(h, "", sim.colorcomponent_ambient, {0.5, 0.5, 0.5}) sim.setObjectAlias(h, names[i]) end

method.name: importShape
method.description: Imports a shape from a file (first imports meshes, then groups/merges them into a shape)

param.name: fileformat
param.description: set to 0. Fileformat is automatically detected

param.name: pathAndFilename
param.description: the location of the file to import.

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices
bit1 set (2): reserced. keep at 0.
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep at 0.
bit3 set (8): do not preserve colors
bit4 set (16): tries to preserve textures.
bit5 set (32): realigns the shape's bounding box with the world.
bit7 set (128): ignore up-vector coded in fileformat.

param.name: identicalVerticeTolerance
param.description: bit0 set (1): keep identical vertices

param.name: scalingFactor
param.description: bit1 set (2): reserced. keep at 0.

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: the handle of the imported shape

method.name: insertObjectIntoOctree
method.description: Inserts an object into an OC tree , as voxels. Each voxel will store a color and a tag value

param.name: octreeHandle
param.description: handle of the OC tree

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object to insert. Only potentially collidable objects are supported

param.name: options
param.description: reserved. Set to 0

param.name: color
param.description: array of RGB triplet, specifying the red, green and blue color components (0 - 255). Can be None/nil

param.name: tag
param.description: uint32 value, which is user-defined

param.name: totalVoxelCnt
param.description: the total number of voxels in the OC tree

method.name: insertObjectIntoPointCloud
method.description: Inserts an object into a point cloud , as points

param.name: pointCloudHandle
param.description: handle of the point cloud

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object to insert. Only potentially collidable objects are supported

param.name: options
param.description: reserved. Set to 0

param.name: gridSize
param.description: when a shape is inserted, it will first be converted to an OC tree with a given grid or voxel size

param.name: color
param.description: array containing an RGB triplet, specifying the red, green and blue color components (0 - 255). Can be None/nil.

param.name: duplicateTolerance
param.description: a minimum distance tolerance value that is used to avoid duplicate points

param.name: totalPointCnt
param.description: the total number of points in the point cloud

method.name: insertPointsIntoPointCloud
method.description: Inserts points into a point cloud

param.name: pcHandle
param.description: handle of the point cloud, can be combined with sim.handleflag_codedstring, when one wishes to provide point data as a float buffer, and color data as a char buffer

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame
bit1 set (2): the color array contains one RGB triple per point. Otherwise it contains a single RGB triple

param.name: points
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: color
param.description: bit1 set (2): the color array contains one RGB triple per point. Otherwise it contains a single RGB triple

param.name: duplicateTolerance
param.description: array of point positions specified as x/y/z coordinates

param.name: totalPointCnt
param.description: the total number of points in the point cloud

method.name: insertVoxelsIntoOctree
method.description: Inserts voxels into an OC tree . Each voxel will store a color and a tag value

param.name: octreeHandle
param.description: handle of the OC tree, can be combined with sim.handleflag_codedstring, when one wishes to provide point data as a float buffer, color data as a char buffer and tag as an uint32 buffer

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the OC tree reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame
bit1 set (2): the color array contains one RGB triple per point, and the tag array contains one value per point. Otherwise it the color array contains a single RGB triple, and the tag array contains a single value.

param.name: points
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the OC tree reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: color
param.description: bit1 set (2): the color array contains one RGB triple per point, and the tag array contains one value per point. Otherwise it the color array contains a single RGB triple, and the tag array contains a single value.

param.name: tag
param.description: array of voxel positions specified as x/y/z coordinates

param.name: totalVoxelCnt
param.description: the total number of voxels in the OC tree

method.name: intersectPointsWithPointCloud
method.description: Removes points from a point cloud , that do not intersect with the provided points (i.e. the result in the point cloud will be the intersection between the two sets of points). When a point cloud doesn't use an OC tree calculation structure, then this operation cannot be performed

param.name: pcHandle
param.description: handle of the point cloud

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: points
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: tolerance
param.description: array of point positions specified as x/y/z coordinates

param.name: totalPointCnt
param.description: the total number of points in the point cloud

method.name: isDynamicallyEnabled
method.description: Checks whether a scene object is dynamically enabled, i.e. is being handled and simulated by the physics engine. Note that until the physics engine has parsed the scene in the first simulation step (i.e. the first time sim.handleDynamics is called), no object will be dynamically enabled

param.name: objectHandle

param.name: dynamicallyEnabled
param.description: whether the object is dynamically enabled

method.name: isHandle
method.description: Checks whether a general object handle is still valid. When a general object is destroyed (e.g. programmatically or via the user interface), then its related handle is not valid anymore and will trigger an error when used. Use this function to avoid triggering an error

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object

param.name: result
param.description: whether the handle is valid

method.name: moduleEntry
method.description: Creates, modifies or destroys module menu entries. Those are user selectable items located in [Menu bar > Modules]. When selected, the corresponding script will have its sysCall_moduleEntry callback function triggered, or sim_message_eventcallback_moduleentry triggered

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of a module menu entry, or -1 to create one.

param.name: label
param.description:
label of the module entry. If handle is -1, then a path can be specified, in order to build sub-menus, e.g. "Menu
Submenu1
Submenu2
Label". Can be nullptr if handle is not -1.

param.name: state
param.description:
Bit-coded (is ignored if set to -1, -2 destroys an existing item):
bit0 is set (1): the item is enabled
bit1 is set (2): the item is checked
bit2 is set (4): the item is checkable

param.name: handle
param.description: the handle of the module menu entry

method.name: moveToConfig
method.description: Executes a n-DoF motion using the Ruckig online trajectory generator . This function can only be called from scripts running in a thread, since this is a blocking operation

param.name: params
param.description:
parameters of the function:
pos : mandatory if joints is not specified. Specifies the current configuration as a vector with one value per DoF
joints : mandatory if pos is not specified. Specifies the joint handles as a vector with one handle per DoF
targetPos : specifies the target configuration as a vector with one value per DoF
flags : optional. Ruckig flags , -1 for default flags.
vel : optional. Specifies current velocity as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
accel : optional. Specifies current acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
maxVel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
minVel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to -maxVel if omitted
maxAccel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
minAccel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to -maxAccel if omitted
maxJerk : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed jerk as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
targetVel : optional. Specifies the target velocity as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
callback : optional. Callback function called for each motion step. The argument provided to the callback function is the current motion state
auxData : optional. Data to be forwarded to the callback function
cyclicJoints : optional. Indicates which joint is cyclic (for cyclic joints, the movement always goes in the direction that represents the shortest distance to the goal). Defaults to [false, false, ...] is omitted
timeStep : optional. The desired time step size. A value of 0 indicates that the current simulation time step is used. Defaults to 0 if omitted

param.name: data
param.description: current motion state

method.name: sim.moveToConfig_init
method.description: Initiates a n-DoF motion using the Ruckig online trajectory generator

param.name: params
param.description:
parameters of the function:
pos : mandatory if joints is not specified. Specifies the current configuration as a vector with one value per DoF
joints : mandatory if pos is not specified. Specifies the joint handles as a vector with one handle per DoF
targetPos : specifies the target configuration as a vector with one value per DoF
flags : optional. Ruckig flags , -1 for default flags.
vel : optional. Specifies current velocity as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
accel : optional. Specifies current acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
maxVel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
minVel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to -maxVel if omitted
maxAccel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
minAccel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to -maxAccel if omitted
maxJerk : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed jerk as a vector with one value per DoF, or as a scalar (scaled to a DoF-vector). Defaults to [inf, inf, ...] if omitted
targetVel : optional. Specifies the target velocity as a vector with one value per DoF. Defaults to [0, 0, ...] if omitted
callback : optional. Callback function called for each motion step. The argument provided to the callback function is the current motion state
auxData : optional. Data to be forwarded to the callback function
cyclicJoints : optional. Indicates which joint is cyclic (for cyclic joints, the movement always goes in the direction that represents the shortest distance to the goal). Defaults to [false, false, ...] is omitted
timeStep : optional. The desired time step size. A value of 0 indicates that the current simulation time step is used. Defaults to 0 if omitted

param.name: motionObject
param.description: a motion object

method.name: sim.moveToConfig_step
method.description: Steps a motion object

param.name: motionObject
param.description: a motion object

param.name: res
param.description:
step result:
negative : error
0 : step successful, motion is still ongoing

2 : motion aborted

param.name: data
param.description: error

method.name: moveToPose
method.description: Executes an object motion using the Ruckig online trajectory generator , by performing interpolations between two poses. The function can operate by handling 4 motion variables (x,y,z and angle between the two poses), or a single movement variable (t, which requires a metric to be specified for distance calculation between the two poses). This function can only be called from a script running in a thread, since this is a blocking operation

param.name: params
param.description:
parameters of the function:
pose : mandatory if neither object nor ik are specified. Specifies current pose
object : mandatory if neither pose nor ik are specified. Specifies the handle of the object to move
ik : mandatory if neither pose nor object are specified. Contains IK-relevant informations, if a kinematic chain should move via IK to a target:
tip : specifies the handle of the tip object (on the end-effector)
target : specifies the handle of the target object (the object to reach)
base : optional. Specifies the handle of the base object (the base of the kinematic chain). Defaults to -1
joints : optional. Specifies the handles of the joints involved in IK calculations. Defaults to all joints within tip and base
method : optional. Specifies the resolution method. Defaults to simIK.method_damped_least_squares
damping : optional. Specifies the resolution damping. Defaults to 0.02
iterations : optional. Specifies the max. number of iterations. Defaults to 20
constraints : optional. Specifies the constraints. Defaults to simIK.constraint_pose
precision : optional. Specifies the desired precision. Defaults to [0.001, 0.5 * math.pi / 180.0]
allowError : optional. Specifies whether a resolution with precision values over what is allowed will be applied anyway. Defaults to params.ik.allowError
breakFlags : optional. Specified the reasons-flags required for simIK.handleGroup to fail Defaults to 0
targetPose : specifies the target pose
targetVel : optional. Specifies the target velocity. Defaults to [0, ...] if omitted
flags : optional. Ruckig flags , -1 for default flags.
metric : optional. A metric to compute a pose-pose distance. If omitted, the motion calculation happens in the 4-dimensional space (dim = 4: x, y, z, angle), otherwise it happens in the 1-dimensional space (dim = 1: t)
maxVel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to [inf, ...] if omitted
minVel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to -maxVel if omitted
maxAccel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to [inf, ...] if omitted
minAccel : optional. Specifies the minimum allowed acceleration as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to -maxAccel if omitted
maxJerk : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed jerk as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to [inf, ...] if omitted
callback : optional. Callback function called for each motion step. The argument provided to the callback function is the current motion state
auxData : optional. Data to be forwarded to the callback function
timeStep : optional. The desired time step size. A value of 0 indicates that the current simulation time step is used. Defaults to 0 if omitted

param.name: data
param.description: current motion state

The function can operate by handling 4 motion variables (x,y,z and angle between the two poses), or a single movement variable (t, which requires a metric to be specified for distance calculation between the two poses)

maxVel : optional. Specifies the maximum allowed velocity as a vector with one value per dim, or as a scalar (scaled to a dim-vector). Defaults to [inf, ...] if omitted

method.name: packDoubleTable
method.description: Packs ab array of double floating-point numbers into a string

param.name: doubleNumbers
param.description: array of double floating-point numbers. Non-numbers will be packed as zero values

param.name: startDoubleIndex
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: doubleCount
param.description: amount of doubles that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available doubles should be packed from the indicated startDoubleIndex)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed double floating-point numbers

method.name: packFloatTable
method.description: Packs an array of floating-point numbers into a string

param.name: floatingNumbers
param.description: array containing floating-point numbers. Non-numbers will be packed as zero values

param.name: startFloatIndex
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: floatCount
param.description: amount of floats that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available floats should be packed from the indicated startFloatIndex)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed floating-point numbers

method.name: packInt32Table
method.description: Packs an array of int32 numbers into a string

param.name: int32Numbers
param.description: array containing int32 numbers. Non-numbers will be packed as zero values

param.name: startInt32Index
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: int32Count
param.description: amount of int32s that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available int32s should be packed from the indicated startInt32Index)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed int32 numbers

method.name: packTable
method.description: Packs a table into a buffer. Functions and other non-serializable items will be packed as string or None/nil values. You can also use sim.packTable to quickly compare two tables

param.name: aTable
param.description: array or map

param.name: packingScheme
param.description: 0 for CoppeliaSim format, 1 for CBOR format, 2 for CBOR format where doubles are packed as floats. When CBOR format is selected, strings with an @:txt: suffix will be forcibly packed as text, and strings with an @:dat: suffix will be forcibly packed as byte buffer

param.name: buffer
param.description: a data buffer

method.name: packUInt16Table
method.description: Packs an array of uint16 numbers into a string

param.name: uint16Numbers
param.description: array containing uint16 numbers. Invalid uint16 numbers will be packed in an undefined manner.

param.name: startUint16Index
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: uint16Count
param.description: amount of uint16s that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available uint16s should be packed from the indicated startUint16Index)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed uint16 numbers

method.name: packUInt32Table
method.description: Packs an array of uint32 numbers into a string

param.name: uint32Numbers
param.description: array containing uint32 numbers. Non-numbers will be packed as zero values

param.name: startUint32Index
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: uint32Count
param.description: amount of uint32s that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available uint32s should be packed from the indicated startUint32Index)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed uint32 numbers

method.name: packUInt8Table
method.description: Packs an array of uint8 numbers into a string

param.name: uint8Numbers
param.description: array containing uint8 numbers. Invalid byte number will be packed in an undefined manner.

param.name: startUint8Index
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: uint8count
param.description: amount of uint8s that should be packed. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum available uint8s should be packed from the indicated startUint8Index)

param.name: data
param.description: a buffer (values between 0 and 255) that contains the uint8 numbers

method.name: pauseSimulation
method.description: Requests a pause of a simulation

method.name: quitSimulator
method.description: Triggers a quit signal after which the application eventually ends

method.name: readTexture

param.name: textureId
param.description: ID of the texture. See also simGetTextureId .

param.name: options
param.description: reserved for future functionality. Set to zero.

param.name: posX
param.description: x/y position of the texture portion to retrieve. Set to [0 0] to retrieve the full texture

param.name: posY
param.description: x/y size of the texture portion to retrieve. Set to [0 0] to retrieve the full texture

param.name: textureData

method.name: refreshDialogs
method.description: Refreshes CoppeliaSim's internal dialogs. Calling sim.refreshDialogs will not trigger a sim.message_eventcallback_refreshdialogs message

param.name: refreshDegree
param.description: refresh degree (0=light, 1=medium, 2=full)

method.name: registerScriptFuncHook
method.description: Registers a script function hook for callback functions , that will be executed before or after the specified function. Calling this function a second time with the same arguments will unregister a previous hook

param.name: funcToHook
param.description: function to hook

param.name: userFunc
param.description: user function

param.name: execBefore
param.description: if true, the user function is called before the function to hook. Otherwise it is called after

param.name: result
param.description: 1 if the hook registration was successful, or 0 if a previous hook was removed

method.name: relocateShapeFrame
method.description: Repositions and reorients the reference frame of a shape, while keeping the mesh in place. The shape's inertia properties are unaffected.

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape

param.name: pose
param.description: pose for the shape's reference frame. The pose is expressed as [x y z qx qy qz qw]. A pose containing only zeros relocates the frame to the center of the mesh's bounding box

param.name: result
param.description: 0 if the frame could not be relocated (the frame of primitive shapes cannot be relocated), otherwise 1.

method.name: removeDrawingObject
method.description: Removes a previously added drawing object

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of a previously added drawing object

method.name: removeParticleObject
method.description: Removes a previously added particle object

param.name: objectHandle
