method.name: removePointsFromPointCloud
method.description: Removes points from a point cloud . When a point cloud doesn't use an OC tree calculation structure, then individual points cannot be removed, only all points can be removed in that case

param.name: pointCloudHandle
param.description: handle of the point cloud

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: points
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the point cloud reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: tolerance
param.description: point positions specified as x/y/z coordinates. Set to None/nil to remove all points

param.name: totalPointCnt
param.description: total number of points in the point cloud

method.name: removeVoxelsFromOctree
method.description: Removes voxels from an OC tree

param.name: octreeHandle
param.description: handle of the OC tree

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the OC tree reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: points
param.description: bit0 set (1): specified points are relative to the OC tree reference frame, otherwise they are relative to the world reference frame

param.name: totalVoxelCnt
param.description: total number of voxels in the OC tree

method.name: resamplePath
method.description: Returns a resampled path

param.name: path
param.description: path, specified in row-major order, e.g. a path containing two 3D poses (position+quaternion) would be [x1 y1 z1 qx1 qy1 qz1 qw1 x2 y2 z2 qx2 qy2 qz2 qw2]

param.name: pathLengths
param.description: lengths of a path. Each path point should have a corresponding length value (as the distance from the path's first point, along the path). See also sim.getPathLengths .

param.name: finalConfigCnt
param.description: number of points or configurations the resampled path should contain

param.name: method
param.description: optional map specifying the type of interpolation (linear or quadraticBezier), and whether the path should be considered as open, even if the first and last path points overlap, and the bezier strength (0.05-1.0)

param.name: types
param.description: optional array specifying the type of each configuration value/dimension: 0=cartesian value, 1=2pi-cyclic value, 2=quaternion value. e.g. a configuration representing 3D poses should use a types argument [0 0 0 2 2 2 2], a configuration representing revolute and cyclic joints should use a types argument [1 1 1 ...]

param.name: outputPath
param.description: the resampled path

method.name: resetDynamicObject
method.description: Dynamically resets an object that is dynamically simulated. This means that the object representation in the dynamics engine is removed, and added again. This can be useful when the set-up of a dynamically simulated chain needs to be modified during simulation (e.g. joint or shape attachement position/orientation changed)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_model , if you wish to reset all objects in a model (where objectHandle would be the model base).

method.name: resetGraph
method.description: Resets a graph object (i.e. clears all its data streams)

param.name: graphHandle
param.description: handle of the graph object

method.name: resetProximitySensor
method.description: Clears the detection state, detection color, detection segments, etc. of a proximity sensor object

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the proximity sensor object or sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit

method.name: resetVisionSensor
method.description: Clears the detection state, etc. of a proximity sensor object

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor object or sim.handle_all or sim.handle_all_except_explicit

method.name: ruckigPos
method.description: Executes a call to the Ruckig online trajectory generator . The Ruckig online trajectory generator provides instantaneous trajectory generation capabilities for motion control systems. This function prepares a position-based trajectory generation object, that can then be calculated with sim.ruckigStep . When this object is not needed anymore, remove it with sim.ruckigRemove

param.name: dofs
param.description: number of degrees of freedom (n).

param.name: baseCycleTime
param.description: smallest expected cycle time. The cycle time should always be a multiple of baseCycleTime. Use a value of 0.0001 (0.1ms).

param.name: flags
param.description: Ruckig flags . -1 for default flags.

param.name: currentPosVelAccel
param.description: current position, velocity and acceleration: [pos_1 ... pos_n vel_1 ... vel_n accel_1 ... accel_n] (one value for each DoF)

param.name: maxVelAccelJerk
param.description: maximum allowed velocity, acceleration and jerk: [maxV_1 ... maxV_n maxA_1 ... maxA_n maxJ_1 ... maxJ_n]. If sim.ruckig_minvel is specified in flags, then maxVelAccelJerk should contain following additional values: [minV_1 ... minV_n]. If sim.ruckig_minaccel is specified in flags, then maxVelAccelJerk should contain following additional values: [minA_1 ... minA_n]

param.name: selection
param.description: selection vector (one value for each DoF). For a default behaviour, fill the vector with non-zero values.

param.name: targetPosVel
param.description: target position and velocity: [tPos_1 ... tPos_n tVel_1 ... tVel_n]

param.name: handle
param.description: the handle to the created object

method.name: ruckigRemove
method.description: Removes an object previously created via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel .

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of the object created via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel .

method.name: ruckigStep
method.description: Executes a call to the Ruckig online trajectory generator . The Ruckig online trajectory generator provides instantaneous trajectory generation capabilities for motion control systems. This function steps forward a trajectory generation algorithm previously prepared via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel

param.name: handle
param.description: handle of the object created via sim.ruckigPos or sim.ruckigVel .

param.name: cycleTime
param.description: cycle time or simulation step. Should always be a multiple of the base cycle time

param.name: result
param.description:
return value of the update function in the motion library:
1: Result::Finished (final state reached)
0: Result::Working (final state not yet reached)
-100: Result::ErrorInvalidInput
-101: Result::ErrorTrajectoryDuration
-110: Result::ErrorExecutionTimeCalculation
-111: Result::ErrorSynchronizationCalculation

param.name: newPosVelAccel
param.description: 1: Result::Finished (final state reached)

param.name: synchronizationTime
param.description: 0: Result::Working (final state not yet reached)

method.name: ruckigVel
method.description: Executes a call to the Ruckig online trajectory generator . The Ruckig online trajectory generator provides instantaneous trajectory generation capabilities for motion control systems. This function prepares a velocity-based trajectory generation object, that can then be calculated with sim.ruckigStep . When this object is not needed anymore, remove it with sim.ruckigRemove

param.name: dofs
param.description: number of degrees of freedom (n).

param.name: baseCycleTime
param.description: smallest expected cycle time. The cycle time should always be a multiple of baseCycleTime. Use a value of 0.0001 (0.1ms).

param.name: flags
param.description: Ruckig flags . -1 for default flags.

param.name: currentPosVelAccel
param.description: current position, velocity and acceleration: [pos_1 ... pos_n vel_1 ... vel_n accel_1 ... accel_n] (one value for each DoF)

param.name: maxAccelJerk
param.description: maximum allowed acceleration and jerk: [maxA_1 ... maxA_n maxJ_1 ... maxJ_n]. If sim.ruckig_minaccel is specified in flags, then maxAccelJerk should contain following additional values: [minA_1 ... minA_n]

param.name: selection
param.description: selection vector (one value for each DoF). For a default behaviour, fill the vector with non-zero values.

param.name: targetVel
param.description: target velocity (one value for each DoF)

param.name: handle
param.description: the handle of the created object

method.name: serialCheck
method.description: Reads how many bytes are waiting to be read on a serial port (RS-232)

param.name: portHandle
param.description: handle returned by the simSerialOpen function

param.name: result
param.description: the number of bytes that are waiting to be read

method.name: serialClose
method.description: Closes a serial port (RS-232)

param.name: portHandle
param.description: handle returned by sim.serialOpen

method.name: serialOpen
method.description: Opens a serial port (RS-232) for communication. When called from a script, the function can only be called when the simulation is running (and in that case the port is automatically closed at simulation stop)

param.name: portString
param.description: string specifying the port to open. Under Windows, use something similar to "\\.\COM1". Under MacOS and Linux, use something similar to "/dev/*" (check the "/dev" folder to know what file to specify). Under Linux, you might have to launch CoppeliaSim with super user priviledges in order to access the serial port

param.name: baudRate
param.description: baudrate

param.name: result
param.description: the port handle

method.name: serialRead
method.description: Reads from a previously opened serial port (RS-232). The C version of the function cannot be blocking

param.name: portHandle
param.description: handle returned by the sim.serialOpen function

param.name: dataLengthToRead
param.description: maximum data length that should be read

param.name: blockingOperation
param.description: if true and the calling script is running in a thread, then the function only returns when the desired data length was read (or if the closingString was met, or if there was a timeout (see next arguments)

param.name: closingString
param.description: string (containing any byte value) can be specified, that will break from the blocking operation if a match was found in the incoming data. Useful when you know that a data packet is always ended with a given signature. Can be an empty string for default operation.

param.name: timeout
param.description: duration after which the blocking operation will be aborted, or 0 if the timeout is infinite

param.name: data
param.description: a string containing read data (excluding the closingString if it was specified and found)

method.name: serialSend
method.description: Writes data to a previously opened serial port (RS-232)

param.name: portHandle
param.description: handle returned by the sim.serialOpen function

param.name: data
param.description: pointer to the data that should be sent

param.name: charsSent
param.description: the effective data length that was written

method.name: setJointDependency

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): points have random colors
bit1 set (2): show OC tree structure
bit2 set (4): reserved. keep unset

method.name: transformImage
method.description: Transforms an image in various ways

param.description: buffer to rgb or rgba values of the image. Beware that in Lua, this image buffer will be modified!

param.name: resolution
param.description: resolution of the image

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the provided image is rgba (or a depth buffer, i.e. one double per image pixel), otherwise it is rgb
bit1 set (2): the image will be flipped on its x-axis

method.name: unpackDoubleTable
method.description: Unpacks a string (or part of it) into an array of double floating-point numbers

param.description: string (values between 0 and 255) that contains packed floating-point numbers

param.name: startDoubleIndex
param.description: zero-based index from which on data should be unpacked (from data[8*startDoubleIndex+1+additionalByteOffset]). Can be omitted in which case 0 is used

param.name: doubleCount
param.description: amount of doubles that should be unpacked. Can be omitted in which case 0 is used (which indicates that the maximum of doubles should be unpacked from the indicated startIndex)

param.name: additionalByteOffset
param.description: byte offset that will be added before reading the doubless. Can be omitted, in which case 0 is used.

param.name: doubleNumbers
param.description: array containing unpacked double floating-point numbers

param.name: floatingNumbers

method.name: wait
method.description: Waits for a certain amount of time

param.name: deltaTime
param.description: minimum time duration to wait

param.name: simulationTime
param.description: indicates whether we want to wait in terms of simulation- or real-time

param.name: deltaTimeLeft
param.description: "wait resolution" of this function is the simulation time step, and the sim.wait command may overshoot the requested waiting time. deltaTimeLeft is the negative overshoot time. If the function was called at simulation time X, and the function returned at simulation time Y, then deltaTimeLeft is deltaTime-(Y-X). deltaTimeLeft is also memorized internally on a thread-basis and used as compensation or correction factor in subsequent blocking commands. deltaTimeLeft is 0 if the simulationTime argument was false

method.name: addForceAndTorque
method.description: Adds a force and/or torque to a shape object that is dynamically enabled. Forces are applied at the center of mass. Added forces and torques are cumulative, and are reset to zero after sim.handleDynamics was called (or by using the following flags: sim.handleflag_resetforce and/or sim.handleflag_resettorque)

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of a dynamically enabled shape. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_resetforce and/or sim.handleflag_resettorque in order to clear the accumulated force or torque.

param.name: force
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the force (in absolute coordinates) to add. Can be None/nil

param.name: torque
param.description: array of 3 values that represent the torque (in absolute coordinates) to add. Can be None/nil

type of object (or group of objects) to remove. Following are allowed values:
sim.handle_single (for a single object)
sim.handle_all (for all objects in the scene)
sim.handle_tree (for a tree of objects)
sim.handle_chain (for a chain of objects (i.e. an inverted tree)).

param.name: options

param.description: handle of the joint object

param.name: forceOrTorque
param.description: maximum force or torque the joint can exert

param.name: signedValue
param.description: if true, the sign of the force/torque indicates the desired movement direction

method.name: setJointTargetPosition
method.description: Sets the target linear/angular position of a joint. When in kinematic mode, the joint moves according to a motion profile that respects maximum velocity, acceleration and jerk values. In dynamic and position/custom control mode, the controller is instructed about the desired position

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the joint object

param.name: targetPosition
param.description: target position of the joint

param.name: motionParams
param.description: when in kinematic mode: the maximum allowed velocity, acceleration and jerk. When in dynamics mode with position control and motion profile enabled, the maximum allowed velocity, acceleration and jerk. Can be None/nil for default values. See also the maxVelAccelJerk property

method.name: setJointTargetVelocity
method.description: Sets the target linear/angular velocity of a non-spherical joint. When in kinematic mode, the joint moves according to a motion profile that respects maximum acceleration and jerk values. In dynamic and velocity control mode, the controller is instructed about the desired velocity

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the joint object

param.name: targetVelocity
param.description: target velocity of the joint

param.name: motionParams
param.description: when the joint is in kinematic mode: the maximum allowed acceleration and jerk. When in dynamic mode with motion profile control enabled: the maximum allowed acceleration and jerk. Can be None/nil for default values. See also the maxVelAccelJerk property

method.name: setObjectParent
method.description: Sets an object's parent object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
parentObjectHandle
param.description: handle of the object that will become parent, or -1 if the object should become parentless. In an assembly operation, the assembly dummy on the parent object should be specified instead

param.name: keepInPlace
param.description: indicates whether the object's absolute pose should stay same

method.name: setObjectPose
method.description: Sets the pose of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Combine with sim.handleflag_wxyzquat to provide the quaternion as [qw qx qy qz] order instead of [qx qy qz qw] order. Can also be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: p
param.description: the pose: [x, y, z, qx, qy, qz, qw])

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the pose is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute pose, sim.handle_inverse to set the inverse of the absolute pose, sim.handle_parent to set the pose relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the pose is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the pose is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the pose is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

method.name: setObjectPosition
method.description: Sets the position (x, y and z-coordinates) of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Can be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: pos
param.description: the object position

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the position is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute position, sim.handle_parent to set the position relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the position is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the position is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the position is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

method.name: setObjectQuaternion
method.description: Sets the quaternion of an object. Dynamically simulated objects, together with their hierarchy tree, are dynamically reset (this however does not apply to static shapes)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the object. Combine with sim.handleflag_wxyzquat to provide the quaternion as [qw qx qy qz] order instead of [qx qy qz qw] order. Can also be combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe

param.name: quat
param.description: the quaternion: [qx, qy, qz, qw]

param.name: relativeToObjectHandle
param.description: indicates relative to which reference frame the orientation is specified. Specify sim.handle_world to set the absolute orientation, sim.handle_parent to set the orientation relative to the object's parent, or an object handle relative to whose reference frame the orientation is specified. If this handle is the handle of a joint, then the quaternion is applied relative to the joint's moving frame (unless is combined with sim.handleflag_reljointbaseframe, in which case the quaternion is applied relative to the joint's base frame)

method.name: setReferencedHandles
method.description: Attaches a list of custom handles to a given scene object. Those custom handles are handles of other scene objects, that are linked to the given scene object (for whatever purpose). The advantage of storing references to other objects with this function is that CoppeliaSim will take care of correctly adjusting the references if needed: For instance, imagine objectA storing the handle of objectB via this function. If objectB is deleted, then the stored handle becomes -1. If objectA and objectB are duplicated at the same time, then the duplicate of objectA stores the handle of the duplicate of objectB . Optionally, if sim.handleflag_keeporiginal is specified, then linking to original objects is guaranteed, e.g. in above example, after a duplication of objectA , the duplicate of objectA will store the handle of the original objectB (if objectB still exists)

param.name: objectHandle
param.description: handle of the scene object that will store the list of handles. Can be optionally combined with sim.handleflag_keeporiginal , in which case the handles that link to originals are retrieved

param.name: referencedHandles
param.description: list of scene object handles.

param.name: tag
param.description: a tag: handles will be stored under this tag. Defaults to an empty tag

method.name: setShapeTexture
method.description: Applies/removes a texture to/from a shape

param.name: shapeHandle
param.description: handle of the shape.

param.name: textureId
param.description: ID of the texture or -1 to remove any existing texture. See also sim.getTextureId , sim.getShapeTextureId and sim.createTexture

param.name: mappingMode
param.description: texture mapping mode .

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0: if set (1), then adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated.
bit1: if set (2), then the texture is applied as a decal (its appearance won't be influenced by light conditions).
bit2: if set (4), then the texture will be repeated along the U direction.
bit3: if set (8), then the texture will be repeated along the V direction.

param.name: uvScaling
param.description: bit0: if set (1), then adjacent texture pixels are not interpolated.

param.name: position
param.description: bit1: if set (2), then the texture is applied as a decal (its appearance won't be influenced by light conditions).

param.name: orientation
param.description: bit2: if set (4), then the texture will be repeated along the U direction.

method.name: setVisionSensorImg
method.description: Writes the image of a vision sensor (and applies any image processing via the vision callback functions ). Make sure the vision sensor is flagged as external input

param.name: sensorHandle
param.description: handle of the vision sensor object

param.name: image
param.description: buffer containing the image

param.name: options
param.description:
options, bit-coded:
bit0 set (1): the provided image is a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image (3 bytes per pixel)
bit1 set (2): the provided image has one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

param.name: pos
param.description: bit0 set (1): the provided image is a greyscale image (1 byte per pixel), otherwise an RGB image (3 bytes per pixel)

param.name: size
param.description: bit1 set (2): the provided image has one additional byte per pixel, as alpha channel (RGBA or greyscale+A)

method.name: writeTexture
method.description: Overwrites a specific texture (or a portion of it) with RGB data

param.name: textureId
param.description: ID of the texture. See also sim.getTextureId

param.name: options
param.description:
bit-coded:
bit0 reserved. Do not set
bit1 reserved. Do not set
bit2 set (4)=only an elliptical/circular portion of the texture data will be written

param.name: textureData
param.description: reserved. Do not set

param.name: posX
param.description: reserved. Do not set

param.name: posY
param.description: set (4)=only an elliptical/circular portion of the texture data will be written

param.name: sizeX
param.description: RGB data to write onto the texture. Each pixel is represented with 3 bytes (0-255)

param.name: sizeY
param.description: x/y position where to copy the RGB data. Set to 0/0 to overwrite the full texture

param.name: interpolation
param.description: x/y size of the RGB data. Set to 0/0 to overwrite the full texture
